title.narrative: JUSTICE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: Increased national capacity and delivery of services to ensure children protection from violence, abuse and exploitation in humanitarian situations are sustained and promoted, which contributes to Access To Justice, Justice For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2010-2018 - Outcome 3 / Child Protection: Girls and boys live in a protective environment in accordance to international standards on child rights and protection by the end of 2018.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased national capacity and delivery of services to ensure children protection from violence, abuse and exploitation inhumanitarian situations are sustained and promoted

description.narrative: In 2018, 338 minors in conflict with the law (including 46 girls) were assisted directly through UNICEF supported projects and 180 judicial actors were trained through support and advocacy provided by UNICEF, leading to a significant reduction in convictions of children | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018
